title: "How can the use of specific language enhance coaching results and group cohesion?"
first_phrase: In this text on coaching, the author explains how using "we" instead of "you" when addressing clients in coaching sessions encourages joint problem solving and coherence. The author then suggests a list of relevant terms related to coherence, effort, effective management, and value production that can be used in coaching sessions. Finally, the author presents an example of the concepts in action in a standard coaching session. These terms include collaborate, control, produce, and generate. The text emphasizes the importance of coaching in unlocking clients' potential and encouraging new ideas.

last_phrase: In conclusion, by utilizing specific terms and phrases, coaching can help individuals and teams to achieve their objectives, think beyond linear thought processes, and increase their productivity and efficiency. It is important to focus on collaboration, explore new possibilities, and create value for oneself and others. Coaching can also be applied to one's collaborators, providing guidance and support towards achieving mutual goals. Asking for advice, discussing, and planning together can lead to greater satisfaction and progress in achieving shared objectives.
